73.title: Nique et la Soucoupe Volante ; 6 "Toi, tu n'entends rien à la mécanique!"
73.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Nique veut absolument pénétrer à l'intérieur de la soucoupe volante découverte part Pat."

74.title: Nique et la Soucoupe Volante ; 7 "Ne touchez à rien s'il vous plaît!"
74.author: Erik
74.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 7 (Feb. 13, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique et Pat visitent l'intérieur de la soucoupe volante découverte par Pat."
The flying saucer takes off unexpectedly, and a voice addresses them from a wall speaker.

75.title: Nique et la Soucoupe Volante ; 8 "Il me semble que nous descendons!"
75.author: Erik
75.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 8 (Feb. 20, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: Summary: "Une soucope volante emporte Pat et Nique. Une voix mystérieuse leur dit de ne rien toucher."
"À suivre."

76.title: Nique et la Soucoupe Volante ; 9 "Le panneau de sortie est en train de s'ouvrir"
76.author: Erik
76.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 9 (Feb. 27, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique, Pat et la pie Prune partent dans un soucoupe volante pour la planète Mars."
"À suivre."

77.title: Nique et la Soucoupe Volante ; 10 "Allons voir le maître"
77.author: Erik

notes: "Résumé: Nique, Pat et la pie Prune, partis dans un soucoupe volante, sont arrivés sur la planète Mars. Le panneau de sortie de la soucoupe s'ouvre."
A robot leads them to it's master.
"À suivre."

78.title: Nique et la Soucoupe Volante ; 11 "C'est vous le martien"
78.author: Erik
78.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 11 (Mar. 13, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique, Pat et la pie Prune, partis dans une soucoupe volante, sont arrivés sur la planète Mars. Un Martien se présente à eux, les conduit auprès du maître."
"À suivre."

79.title: Nique et la Soucoupe Volante ; 12 "Je croyais que les martiens avaient l'exclusivité des soucoupes"
79.author: Erik
79.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 12 (Mar. 20, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: Nique, Pat et la pie Prune sont partis dans un soucoupe volante. Accueilis par le Grand Maître, celui-ci les déçoit en leur apprenant qu'ils sont toujours sur la Terre."
"À suivre."

80.title: Nique et la Soucoupe Volante ; 13 "N'essayez pas de vous échapper, vous êtes mes prisonniers!"
80.author: Erik
80.appears_in: back cover of Lisette, no. 13 (Mar. 27, 1955) in Lisette Album, no. 25.
notes: "Résumé: L'imprudente curiosité de Nique et Pat les conduit chez le Grand Maître, inventeur de soucoupes volantes, qui veut les envoyer sur la planète Mars."
"À suivre."

85.heading: Niranjana, Anupama, 1934-1991.
85.title: Madhavi
85.author: Dr
85.appears_in: Anupama Niranjana avara janapriya kaadambari aadhaarita.
notes: Bangalore : Indya Comics, between 2000 and 2012?
(Sachitra roopadalli khyaati kannada kaadambarigalu ; no. 1

Summary (from publisher's website): Madhavi is a tragic heroine appearing in one of the stories in the Great Epic Mahabharata. During that period women were exploited to the hilt by men and those who completely surrendered themselves to men were known as 'Ideal Women'. Madhavi too, despite being a princess, was a victim of this exploitation. She is so disgusted with the system that when she gets a chance to be free she feels it is all meaningless. She revolts. Dr. Anupama Niranjana has penned this heart rending story of Madhavi.
In Kannada.

Summary (from publisher's website): Madhavi is a tragic heroine appearing in one of the stories in the Great Epic Mahabharata. During that period women were exploited to the hilt by men and those who completely surrendered themselves to men were known as 'Ideal Women'. Madhavi too, despite being a princess, was a victim of this exploitation. She is so disgusted with the system that when she gets a chance to be free she feels it is all meaningless. She revolts. Dr. Anupama Niranjana has penned this heart rending story of Madhavi.

Well, it's like this..."

108.heading: Nishada.
108.title: "Nala-Damayanti"
108.author: script, Prasad Iyer ; art work, Manoj
108.appears_in: 24 p. in Vasan's Chitra Katha, no. 13 (2000?).
notes: "The story of Nala and Damayanti has been well known to the people of this country over the ages. It is one of the episodes of the great epic, the Mahabharatha. The story of Nala and Damayanti was narrated by a Rishi to Yudhishtira, the eldest of the Pandavas, when he was exiled to the forest after losing a game of dice. Nala too was defeated in a game of dice by the machinations of an unscrupulous cousin and had to retire to the forest. The trials and tribulations of Nala and his ultimate triumph is an epic in itself and can be read in this book."
Begins: "Long, long ago, the kingdom of Nishada was ruled by an able king named Nala."

109.heading: Nishadha Kingdom.
109.title: Nala Damayanti.
109.author: [No author]
notes: (Wilco Picture Library ; v. MHD-028)
"Series Indian mythology & tales/ history/divinity."
"For all ages."

"Nala, the handsome and brave king of the Nishadha Kingdom, was told about Damayanti's beauty by Sage Narada, who was always roving within the three worlds. Nala, longing to convey his feelings to Damayanti, the Princess of Vidarbha, used a swan as his messenger and later married her. This title, narrating the story from the epic Mahabharata, enlightens you about the many events that took place before their marriage. The climax of this great love story, translated in Latin in the 19th Century, will leave you wandering the trails of their destiny."

110.title: Nishanth : the Beginnings
110.author: writer, penciler, cover & book designer, Mishanth Gopinathan ; embellishers, Anu & Live Eyes Media Team.
notes: "Translated from the first Malayalam graphic novel."
"For mature audience."

"Set in a small town in 1990s India, the story follows the journey of a young man who falls in love with a girl and soon gets entangled in the sensational murder mystery of a young nun. Will fate keep them apart? Or will love prevail?"

111.heading: Nishi, Jean-Paul.
111.title: À Nous Deux, Paris!
111.author: J
111.appears_in: P. Nishi ; traduit du japonais par Corinne Quentin.
notes: "Titre original: Paris Aishiteruze."

"Quand un jeune Japonais découvre dans ses pérégrinations humoristiques et ironiques les travers de la vie parisienne. Il scrute et déchiffre en images notre quotidien dans ses moindres détails. Il goûte à ses risques et périls les charmes de la France que nous découvrons dans ce livre comme dans un miroir."

117.heading: Nishida, Miho.
117.title: Beauty Pop
117.author: story and art by Kiyoko Arai ; English adaptation, Amanda Hubbard ; translation, Miho Nishida.
notes: (Shojo Beat Manga)

"Although a truly gifted hairstylist, Kiri Koshiba has no interest in using her talent to pursue fame and fortune, unlike the three popular boys in the "Scissors Project" at school. Determined to become the best makeover team in Japan, they give showy makeovers to handpicked girls. As much as Kiri tries to shy away from the Scissors Project spotlight, she finds herself responding to beauty's call. When Kiri's friend Kanako gives a present to one of the members of the Scissors Project, her act of kindness is interpreted as a bribe to get a makeover, and they reject her for being too ugly. Kiri decides to help Kanako and give the boys a lesson in what true beauty is."
